definition: variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: It didn't take very long for the latest fashion trend to catch on.
sentences.chinese: 这个最新的时尚潮流没多久就蔚为一股风潮。

sentences.english: The huge treaty books were ready at last.
sentences.chinese: 蔚为壮观的条约文本终于准备完毕了。

sentences.english: Tianjin once organised 30 families to change houses, which was spectacular .
sentences.chinese: 天津有一次组织30户人家同时搬家换房，蔚为壮观。

sentences.english: Harbour, hundreds of vessels calling at the deep-sea Yulun, such as the mast Lin, Wei was spectacular.
sentences.chinese: 港湾内停靠着数百艘深海渔轮，桅杆如林，蔚为壮观。

sentences.english: This short-lived, yet, spectacular sight takes place in mid to late summer.
sentences.chinese: 这短暂的，然而，蔚为奇观发生在夏季中期至年底。

sentences.english: Fei Bao such as Abas million Hu Teluk nine days, become a spectacular.
sentences.chinese: 飞瀑如珠玑万斛直落九天，蔚为壮观。
蒂索的成功曾经蔚为壮观。

sentences.english: You will see a very spectacular picture.
sentences.chinese: 你将看到一幅蔚为奇观的图片。

sentences.english: Wind over the summer, Mr Mak Hoi-rolled layers of waves, spectacular.
sentences.chinese: 夏风吹过，麦海卷起层层波浪，蔚为壮观。

sentences.english: This new sort of remote medicine is gaining currency.
sentences.chinese: 这种新型的远距医疗，已经慢慢蔚为风潮。

sentences.english: Today, as energy prices soar, revolving buildings have become fashionable.
sentences.chinese: 如今，能源价格高涨，旋转屋蔚为风尚。

sentences.english: With the help of a substantial marketing campaign, the masculine fashion for wristwatches caught on after the war.
sentences.chinese: 战后，由于大量的市场鼓吹，手表也蔚为男性的时尚。

sentences.english: The white sailing boats in the harbor made a pretty scene.
sentences.chinese: 港湾里白帆片片，蔚为美景。

sentences.english: The mountain rain from now on, Hong Yongbao the note, will soar howls, splendid sight.
sentences.chinese: 山雨过后，洪涌瀑注，飞腾叫啸，蔚为壮观。

definition: to afford (a magnificent view etc)/to become (a prevailing fashion etc)
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
vestigial residue/a throwback (to a former age)
to have become common practice (idiom)/to become a general trend
to depend ultimately on (Tw)/absolutely reliant on
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
